hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Ibn Abbas: The Prophet ﷺ performed cupping (hijamah) between the two shoulders and the sides of the body and gave the cupper his fee. If it had been prohibited, he would not have given him his fee.

chainIssues: Presence of weak narrator (Abu Jabir Zayd ibn Abd al-Aziz) in the chain
Firas is Da'if and uses 'an (عَنْ) transmission term, creating ambiguity

Alternation mentioned: 'Firas or Jabir' (فِرَاسٍ أَوْ جَابِرٍ) indicates uncertainty in transmission

potential_issues.issue: Sufyan al-Thawri is classified as mudallis (Type 2)
potential_issues.impact: Although Sufyan is generally reliable and Type 2 mudallis practitioners are acceptable even with 'an, he used direct transmission term (حَدَّثَنَا) here, which mitigates this concern

Topics: The Prophet's ﷺ practice of cupping (hijamah)
Method of cupping between shoulders and sides

chainIssues: Chain 1 (First path): Muhammad ibn Mudhaffar chain with weak narrators
Chain 2 (Second path): Ibrahim ibn Muhammad ibn Hamzah chain with unknown narrator (Wahb ibn Khanbash)
Both chains have issues with narrators Firas and Wahb ibn Khanbash
The text notes: 'Tafarrada bihi Abd al-Aziz (It was narrated uniquely by Abd al-Aziz from Sufyan from Firas)' - indicating this is an isolated report
The normal transmission is: 'The people narrated it from Sufyan from Jabir and Bayan' - but our chains use Firas instead

potential_issues.issue: Firas is weak (Da'if) and transmits via 'an from al-Sha'bi

potential_issues.issue: Hamid ibn Yahya al-Balkhi is Saduq Yugrib - his narrations are sometimes strange

potential_issues.issue: The hadith is transmitted uniquely (tafarrada) by Abd al-Aziz from Sufyan from Firas, which is unusual
potential_issues.impact: The fact that this chain is unique and uses the weak narrator Firas makes it less reliable than the mainstream transmission through Jabir and Bayan

potential_issues.issue: Sufyan al-Thawri is mudallis (Type 2) and transmits via 'an from both Firas and Bayan
potential_issues.impact: While Sufyan is reliable, his use of 'an with the weak Firas adds to the chain's issues

Topics: Umrah in Ramadan equivalent to Hajj

hadiths.english_translation: Abdullah ibn Masud was asked about a man who left his wife without consummating the marriage. Abdullah hesitated for a month without giving a ruling. Then he said: I give my opinion on this. If it is wrong, the error is from me, and if it is correct, it is from Allah. I say: For her is the gift due to women of her kind, upon her is the waiting period ('iddah), and for her is the inheritance. Then Abu Sinan al-Ashja'i stood up and said: The Prophet ﷺ judged regarding Barwa bint Washiq (with the same ruling). Abdullah was pleased with this.
